Reviews.Title: “Decent stay but needs se renovation”
Reviews.Author: sharvilpatel
Reviews.Content: After having heard some good reviews, we decided to stay at this hotel. We were a bit early and they did not have rooms so we waited for sometime. They were generous enough to offer to open the poolside area where we could spend sometime till the rooms were ready. Overall, the rooms and hotel lobby are nice, but they do seem to have aged now, i don't really know how old this hotel is, but compared to some of the new hotels they do seem a bit old. The breakfast spread was decent, and the omelletes were very nice. Room size was decent but the bathroom was not upto expectations. There was a typical smell emitting from the bathroom. I would say maybe not the best hotel in the area, but good value for money. Thanks, Sharvil

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: anupamapshah
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is amazing - right opposite Burjuman Mall and the metro station. There are small shops and restaurants close by as well. But if you're too tired to leave the place for a meal, room service is decent too. There is an Indian restaurant in the Hotel, and the buffet breakfast has some Indian dishes as well. So don't be surprised if you find a lot of Indians there. The nightclub downstairs could be an issue for some. But if you're used to living in the city, its just like home :) Rooms are decent - Busy street view from the room (and you can open the windows), large beds with comfortable mattresses, and slightly old bathrooms. Its not at all fancy, but definitely worth it for a night stay and breakfast. Who goes to DUBAI for a holiday and stays in the hotel all day anyway? :P

Reviews.Title: “Reception staff unfriendly, decent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: davidoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in late January 2012 with my family. The hotel room was average sized but clean with all the usual amenities. The bathroom were clean but ordinary. The welcome drink on arrival was a nice gesture. The bed was confer table and large (king sized) though we had to pay for it. Decent breakfast with Indian and English options. The hotel is all about location. All types of restaurants, fast foods joints are near this hotel. The local shops and Meena bazaar nearby have good selection of curios to buy. There is a metro station within 2 minutes walk, and the tour office for the Dubai Wonderbus is opposite. The Internet (wifi) is free for fifteen minutes every day, after that it is 20dhs for 1 hour. The main problem for us was during check out. We planned on checking out at 11.00 am and go for some sight seeing. We called up the reception at 9.30 asking them to keep the bills ready. They said the checkout takes only 5 minutes and we just have come out at that time. When we reached there we were asked to wait. We waited till 12.00 for the bill, and when we asked them what was the delay, they said it is our mistake we came there late. By the time we got out it was 1.00pm. Two hours for checkout!!! Overall, it is a decent hotel with good beds. But, the reception has to be improved and doesn't seem worth to be a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!!”
Reviews.Author: Holidayfun_12
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed here for two nights while on our way to Australia. We found it pleasant. The rooms were nice, standard. The bathroom was nice too. The beds were comfortable. The staff were very friendly and accommidating. If your looking for somewhere nice (its not big and fancy) just to lay your head and relax a little, then I really would recommend this hotel and the night club next door is good fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice location ...”
Reviews.Author: Lanster
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent stay at the Regent Palace. The room was clean, as was the bathroom, although the bathroom was somewhat dated. The staff was friendly and attentive. The location was great as it is directly across from the Burjaman Mall and very near a main metro stop. Although not perfect, the Regent Palace offered me a pretty good value in Dubai and I can recommend the property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly decent, well positioned hotel.”
Reviews.Author: really_razamataz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of days over New Year 2012 as part of a large group on a bed and breakfast basis. The hotel room was big and clean with all the usual amenities. The bathroom could perhaps have done with a bit more attention to cleaning of the tile grout but it fine really. I found all the staff to be helpful (the housekeepers were happy to provide extra tea and milk on two occasions when asked, and the front reception staff were efficient). There seemed to be a specific person roaming the ground floor to help (he had a badge labelled 'assistance') and the luggage porters worked hard. All staff had name badges. Greeted with a welcome drink on arrival - nice touch. I didn't use their gym on the top floor and only used the breakfast restuarant on the mezzanine floor. They had other connected restaurants/clubs but the although one of them went on till 3am there really wasn't that much noise audible in the room, even though we were facing the Burjuman shopping centre and the main road. Very good bed mattress and sheets. There are masses and I mean MASSES of restaurant options nearby (either opposite the hotel, or fast food type places on the 3rd floor of the Burjuman shopping centre) or in the local streets around the hotel - especially if you wanted Indian/Pakistani/Asian/Pizza - both take away and eat in, and a good selection of small grocery stores. Decent enough breakfast with English and asian options. Drinks machine not working on second morning but fixed quickly. Egg chef will cook up your desire on demand though it is the other end to the toast and buffet. There is a metro station within 2 minutes walk, and the tour office for the Dubai Wonderbus is opposite. Overall I think it is a perfectly acceptable hotel (wifi is pay-for though, with 15 minutes available for free per day based on MAC address)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Avoid Avoid”
Reviews.Author: WandererMumbaiIndia
Reviews.Content: I along with my family stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The room was ok, nothing great. I requested a street view room which they said they dont have. As mentioned in some of the earlier posts, there is a lot of noise from the disco till 3AM in the night. IT IS NOT FIXED YET and I DONT THINK IT CAN BE!!!! I could not get sleep, so I requested the front desk for a higher floor. After that, 3 of them kept saying that I need to talk to the guy in the next shift. Finally I told one front desk guy (name withheld) that I have not been able to sleep 2 nights in a row and must have a room change. All he did was offered a different room on the same (first) floor. He promised less noise so I accepted, he said the keys would be sent to my room in 15 mins. The keys did not come for next 3 days.. frustrated I did not even ask again... The breakfast spread was good - and the quality too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: keithwilson30
Reviews.Content: Had read the reports about this hotel and was not sure of returning as I stayed here in 2001. The staff are very friendly and efficient. Hotel is clean and the room is quiet and large. This hotel does what it says it's in a good location and is very good value for the money. I am enjoying my stay at the moment and plan to have a relaxing week

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Karthik R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a pretty good hotel if you are looking for budget travel. They offer you a welcome drink as they take a long time for check-in (usually 20~30 min). Rooms are good but maintenance is a problem. There were a few blown out bulbs in the room. Even after 3-4 complaints, the hotel staff did not bother to change it.... Complimentary breakfast is also good. But the hotel fails miserably in managing the mini bar. I suggest that you first check all the contents of the mini bar as per the card present (including shirts, caps, etc). Or else, while checking out they will ask you to pay extra for something that you never took from the minibar. The staff seem more helpful while you are checking in than checking out..... :) Overall, it is a good hotel to stay considering the location. But it should improve a lot in terms of maintenance and service.

Reviews.Title: “WOW Experience”
Reviews.Author: Suman001
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel from all aspects, rooms are pretty large and spacious, situated right infronr of a mall which is an advantage specilly in summer season, food and services are excellent. it is located in central Dubai and all places are easily accessible from Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place and location in Dubai!”
Reviews.Author: Gusar777
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in near of everything in Dubai, You can find lots of exchange offices,food courts and of course the one of the biggest Malls in Dubai- Burjuman Mall in hotel precincts. Rooms in the hotel were re-decorated last year ,so You feel Yourself much comfortable like at home.:) There are spacious bed and huge windows in each room,also there is TV with CNN,Aljazira ,Skynews,.etc. channels, bathroom is very clean and tidy, rooms have safe and mini-bar and nice roomy wardrobe. Personnel in the hotel is very polite and helpful! Also there are several restaurants and Bar's in the hotel, Rock Bottom bar, Indian restaurant and Filipino restaurant, also Mongolian Bar on the roof near outdoor swimming pool. Would recommend it to everyone who wants to feel spirit of Dubai and have all amenities near at hands!

Reviews.Title: “"Comfortable stay with good location"”
Reviews.Author: MSK25
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regent Palace is within the reach for all the locations that are must required. Metro station is walkable distance to the hotel and is just opposite Burjuman shopping center. All kinds of restaurants are within the vicinity of the hotel. Meena Bazaar is just a small drive away from the hotel and so is the bus station if one would like to travel to other places like Abu Dhabi. But the hotel should definitely look into certain necessities in the decent rooms such as electric kettle and tea/coffee bags that was pretty surprising to me at least. Else, the breakfast was very good with few Indian dishes to choose from together with the continental styling as well. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and offer good support to the guests which was almost the contrast at the breakfast time with the waitresses who maintain long faces through out. The only incident disappointed me was when I put the door message to clean up my room and also collect the laundry before leaving for my sightseeing but the latter wasn't honoured. When I enquired of the short coming in the evening, I was flatly told that I did not leave the laundry message!!! Also, most of the times I tried ringing the room service, Assistant Manager & Laundry, the phone only kept ringing without a response and certain times I had to settle down on putting a door message and also spotting a room service boy asking him to clean up my room.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: HongTao1991
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to sleep, and easy to go around. This is a choice worth to consider. It is near to Dubai Metro, just less than 200m from the hotel. Opposite to it is the shopping mall. There are a lot of restaurant near the hotel and open until when late. If you are looking for shopping, there is a departmental store near by which open until 10pm or even later. My tour mate has some bad experience which the door key cannot open the room, the toilet cannot be flushed, .. etc. The buffet breakfast is "ok" one which you can bite on something and go on for your trip on that day. Almost all the staff are non-local people, e.g. Filipinos, Indians, the service really depends on the individual capability. I have told them that my room run out of tissue paper, they only brought in on next day.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, nice and good location”
Reviews.Author: Paggyvr
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regent Palace, Dubai June 27th, 2011 Hello All, I usually handle all my travel arrangements by myself but this time while I was on a business trip to Dubai, I opted for a travel agent's service(Thomas Cook). I was originally booked for a hotel in Bur Dubai nearby Meena Bazaar area. But I was informed by the Thomas cook guys few hours before my departure that my choice of hotel was not available and they were going to put me in Hotel Regent Palace. I checked the hotel's review at tripadvisor and I was a bit apprehensive whether to go for it are fight it out with the Thomas Cook guys and look for some other option. I agreed with them to stay at Regent palace for one night and in meantime asked them to arrange for some other option(especially after reading some really negative reviews). I must say I was surprised with this property. It was my business trip hence I was not expecting something exceptional for my stay but regent palace was way ahead of what I had expected. The location. The hotel is located right opposite Burjuman mall and the metro station is just a minute walk. This excited me because I was suppose to travel everyday to the Dubai convention and exhibition center and best way to travel there is Dubai Metro :-) The main market of Bur dubai is walkable distance. The Property The hotel is very well maintained. The rooms were comfortable, spacious and neat(much against what many of the travellers have complained). Service Well, the service was not exceptionally good but it was not bad either. It was quite reasonable and I was absolutely fine since I was not going to stay in the hotel for long time throughout my stay. However, the can certainly do a lot to improve the service. For instance, one of the days they had some maintenance work with the hotel airconditioning system(which I came to know later). As a result, there wasn't enough cooling in the room the whole night. I kept on calling the housekeeping, front desk, room service and they could not figure out the problem. Finally, a maintenance guy came and told me that the chillers of the central airconditioning had some maintenance that day and it takes few hours for them to start functioning normally. Food Since I use to be away the whole day, I did not try out their restaurants. However, I did take their breakfast coupons and it was a standard breakfast. You would find a lot of options in the breakfast and you'll see a good variety of Indian food on their menu. I guess this has to do with the fact that lot of Indian travellers, both business and leisure stay at this hotel. I saw many of them (including me !) Other than the above, there was nothing much to review about this hotel. Though they claim to be a 4* hotel, I wouldn't rate them above 3*. Will I prefer this hotel next time I travel to Dubai? Absolutely yes!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Services and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Yogesh_Rustagi
Reviews.Content: Very polite, cheerful and coperative staff, Great Lobby, Nice Interiors, Clean and Comfortable rooms, Best Food...... All above it is located in Bur Dubai..near to Burjaman Mall.Regent Palace Dubai IS THE PLACE I WOULD DEFINITLY COME BACK AND WILL RECOMMEND TO MY FRIENDS. Thank you for making my stay so Pleasent!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel ruined our trip!”
Reviews.Author: NynaM
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel ever! Toilet does not flush. Service was the most horrible we've encountered. The staff are just plain rude. Also, most importantly, since our flight arrived at 2 am, we were welcomed by foreigners with their female escorts everywhere. The site of several foreigners with their escorts welcomed us, this was a bad sign already. When we got to our room, our extra bed did not have any pillows at all. Our toilet does not flush and there was a weird odor in the room. Our room for 3 only had 2 towels - great! Asking for assistance from the front desk was a total nightmare. To think we were only asking for airport transfers, but the girl in the front desk rudely dismissed us as if she did not have a care in the world. Once again, RUDE STAFF! SOMEONE SHOULD RE-VISIT THIS HOTEL CAUSE THIS IS NOT A 4-STAR HOTEL! To think we just ended a European tour of 7 countries so we had a basis of comparison with our other hotels. This just ruined the tour for us. We were miserable the entire time we were in this hotel. Bottom line: NOT A 4-STAR HOTEL! If you want comfort and value for your money, go check out the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel with bad service and staff”
Reviews.Author: rajeevtatiwala
Reviews.Content: the location is very good with burjuman mall opposite and metro station only 100 meter away. the south indian restaurent had no dish from south india. the morning breakfast was average. the good variety was on special promo brunches. the room is clean and comfortable but you expect much more when you look at a four star rated hotel. the reception staff was very rude where i got the feeling as if i am staying for free over there and has no privilege even to ask for any assistance

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Raja0
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our Dubai stay here. 4 star hotel all the way. Staff was great and the rooms were very comfortable and impeccably cleaned. A nice surprise is that the hotel is located near shopping malls.And to nearly every corner of the city for just a few dollars each trip. Very safe, convenient, clean and a nice way to explore the city. Hotel has a great pool, about good restaurants (although we admittedly never ate in them) and free and fast wi-fi. Considering the great rate and value for money, we felt that the hotel far exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Clean”
Reviews.Author: vskothari
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and in good location.The staff seemed not very bothered though about the guests..However, the hotel was quite full when we arrived.The breakfast was good and rooms were quite tidy and clean...Setting and layout of the hotel was quite catchy though needs a bit of good maintenance

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Average - would try other options”
Reviews.Author: Stoney50
Reviews.Content: We had not really picked this hotel, it came as a package deal with a Costa cruise and due to the late deal price we got for the overall package, we weren't really going to moan. All I can say it 'it's ok'. It's not terrible, the rooms (we ended up have two different rooms) were ok in size, the bathrooms were a little small, couldn't have two people in there at once, but they were clean, if not a little tired. The staff were really friendly, we had had a night flight and landed in Dubai at 7am in the morning, check-in was not until 2pm, but after arriving at the hotel for about 9 - 9:30am, we were told that we could pay for an earlier check-in. Needing to shower and change clothes we agreed and they asked us to wait for about 20 mins to sort the room out. We ended up waiting over an hour, but had the early check-in charge waived, so we were extremely grateful for that. The disco is VERY loud, reading other reviews before we left, we had requested a high level floor, but even on the fourth floor the disco music from the ground floor was making it to our room ! At 10:40pm on our first night, yes we were in bed, totally wiped-out from the flight, we had a call asking us to move rooms, as they had to complete some emergency work right above our room. Not happy, but not a lot of choice, we dressed, packed and went to see the two rooms we had been offered. They said they would send someone up, they didn't, waited and waited, went down to reception, told them we had picked the room on location (far away as possible from the disco) and wanted the new keys, waited and waited. Went back down to reception and told them just to give me the new key, we would move ourselves. Although a bit of a nightmare, worked out for the best as we could not hear the disco from the new room. Breakfast was ok, plenty there but standard wasn't brilliant. Egg Chef would do anything for you though and he was very good at knowing who was next in line. We didn't pay any extra for breakfast, so can't really moan. Location isn't the best, taxi's are a plenty and they were quite cheap (hotel to Dubai mall about 40DHR = £8) there is a mall right opposite the hotel, but we chose to go to the bigger malls around the city (Don't go to the Times Square mall nothing there). You couldn't walk anywhere, it has to be taxi's or metro, but there was a metro station right opposite as well, although we didn't try that. We went out to the Renaissance Hotel one night to the Spice Island buffet (absolutely amazing you must go!) and that area seemed to have more going on around it, that you could walk to if you wanted. All in all I don't think I would recommend this hotel, I am sure there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: paulamenassa
Reviews.Content: We stayed one loong week in 208, the only good thing is the location.There is zero service:front desk with attitude,house keeping:verry poor,breackfast room:cant get any answers from anyone,and verry dirty and smelly. So is the whole hotel dirty and smelly,the hall ways , the "suite"dirty,in the bathroom we had fruitflies but no fruits of corse.There is a safe in the closet , but never worked. Saddly the complaines got nowhere,and we think that hotel may have been a 4 stars a long time ago, but has lost a couple along the way.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Aks78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regent Palace hotel in as a part of our holiday package to Dubai and I must say it was quite a comfortable stay. The hotel staff was quick with our check in and was kind enough to upgrade our room. The breakfast buffet is nothing great, but basic to cater to its largely Indian clients. Rooms are spacious. They have free wi -fi, which does not work all the time, anyways it is an added privilege. The hotel has a couple of restaurants which serve an array of food ranging from Mongolian, Japanese to Indian. We could not try any of them.But we did order from the room service menu and the food was great. The location of the hotel is just right. Just opposite is the Burjuman center and the metro station, Khalid Bin Walid. This is just 4 stops away from Burj Khalifa(Dubai Mall). The hotel is also quite close to Bastakia (Old Dubai) and Meena Bazar at Bur Dubai, which is a great place to shop for designer perfumes at throw away prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but noisy in evenings from nightclubs.”
Reviews.Author: DonCorleone333 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Good sized rooms and excellent facilities, restaurants etc. Only negative would be noise as could hear nightclubs from bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Guest”
Reviews.Author: WW66
Reviews.Content: Location is good and the food not bad but the hotel service is so bad i stay there for 3 night but can't take a comfortable shower due to the water temperature is very hot. There isn't any cold water at all. The next day we make a complant but no action taken.They even said if we change to another room the problem is the same. One morning after breakfast I ask the helpful waiter to top up half bottle of plain water into my 500ml bottle for my medicine, the helpful waiter is willing to serve me but the person in charge said no plain water I get a shock because right in front of me there is a big jar of water. Finally I realise she wanted me to pay six dirhams to her for the plain water. I was really disappointed for such an answer which came out from the staff of this 4 stars hotel. I was really wandering is this a 4 stars hotel? it looks like below 3 stars hotel to me. The enviroment is noisy and the hotel look like not that new compare to other hotel in Dubai. How do you expet me to come here again for my next business trip?

Reviews.Title: “Nerve-wrecking”
Reviews.Author: abbykal
Reviews.Content: Getting proper services takes ages in this hotel. Staff are polite but don't get much done. Had to wait for 1.5 hours at the airport to be picked up by the hotel transport. Despite booking of transport to the airport, again it was delayed. The swimming pool area was deplorable and unclean. Getting a drink by the pool took close to one hour. Housekeeping was horrible. Lunch was poor/mediocre; the same desserts seemed to be have been sitting there for the past days... I will never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dirty hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: Imranz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 308 which is their so called executive suite. The bedroom was nice but the lounge was pathetic with worn out sofa and a broken, dirty centre table. The toilet particularly was very small and always stinky. Room service was pathetic, used to come in, clean the toilet leaving it stinking even more. Was told that the fruit platter would be replenished daily whereas it was not. For a 4*, the hotel and its rooms were small, for a suite, mine was extremely small. The only thing good about this hotel was that it was in front of the metro station and has several places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “The worst staff ever.”
Reviews.Author: AKh1983
Reviews.Content: Apart from the room rates and proximity to a mall, nothing else is good about this hotel. The loud noise coming out from the club will not yet you get a good night sleep. Another problem has to do with the visa that the hotel "helps" the guests to get. The staff do not know the exact procedures, and they give you misleading information. The sales person kept on delaying presenting the documents to immigration office which delayed the visa issuance for the group when we had a wedding to attend. An amount of AED 5000 per person was blocked from the credit cards of the group as a visa guarantee and was told upon check out to give it 24 hours to reflect only to find out three days later that we have to present the exit stamp on our passports. There is no clear information regarding the visa issuance procedures and the staff you deal with do not know what they are, needless to say that they can not speak in English.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: ammu6630
Reviews.Content: The Regent Palace Hotel a Four Star Deluxe hotel in the heart of the city commenced in early 1997 is situated opposite the Burjuman Center. The hotel offers 144 furnished rooms - Standard, Deluxe and Suites elegantly appointed and featuring beautiful city views. It has been the choice of discerning business and leisure travelers. It is a delightful boutique hotel conveniently located in the heart of the city, a short drive from airport.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind disco noise, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Much_Older_traveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel has 2 Discos. The bass from the discos is carried to all the rooms through the structure. I had a 4 night stay, asked for a quiet room in check-in, was given a room at the back floor 1 and was kept awake until 3 am Boom Boom Boom Boom. Room was changed. 5th floor at front. Quieter boom boom boom, but window catch was faulty so traffic noise came in. Mended it with the match book as a wedge. If you like bars and discos this is the one for you............................. Recommendation would depend on the friend, some don't mind, others do!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: TanveerS
Reviews.Content: Regent Palace is a good place to stay if you are looking at good, clean & comfortable rooms, yet not very heavily priced. At USD 100 - 125, you can get a deluxe room inclusive of breakfast. The room offers most amenities that one would want, and at that price, it does well to put in a LCD TV (unlike most hotels in Dubai). Breakfast is good. Offers a decent spread, which is fresh and tasty. Like most Dubai hotels, it has a couple of evening clubs. I've personally not used them, but I believe they are one of the better ones in the city. The number of peole wanting an entry, would certify! The hotel is coveniently located, 15 to 40 mins drive from the airport, depending on the time of day & traffic. It is easily accessible to most business areas and is right accross, one of Dubai's 'exclusive' mall. The hotel also offers visa services, and can sponsor your visit. Slightly more expensive, but definitely worth the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Regent Palace, Dubai.”
Reviews.Author: balafico
Reviews.Content: I find this hotel reasonably priced and provides a variety of food. Room interiors are imprissive.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel (but not 4 star) with basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: Johhnybi
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a hotel with 4 star amenities better find some other good hotel.. The best +point is the location.. very close to metro station (khalid al waleed - burjuman), zabeel park & dubai creek (abra).. Worst part is the check in procedure... after travelllin by road from oman for 6 hrs we reached the hotel at 2.15 pm & got the room keys at 3.05 pm , 50 min for the checking in .. pathetic !!! Room service & housekeeping the worst !!

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel Located Next to Convenient Mall”
Reviews.Author: msm
Reviews.Content: Our five day stay at the Regent Palace was arranged by business associates who chose it because it is reasonably priced, located across the street from a large shopping mall with restaurants, and is close to business offices. I was satisfied with the hotel and would recommend it for business travelers. We had a corner room that included a separate sitting area. This gave us plenty of space. Ask for a room on the upper floors to get away from noise from the clubs. Water was warm but not hot. I'm probably the only one who wants hot water in the desert. Breakfast was quite varied and very plentiful with food suiting various cultures. The staff was helpful but limited in their knowledge of English. We were never able to get the Internet to work, and tech support couldn't come for days, but a few blocks down the street we found a free wifi hotspot with excellent croissants. Having a mall across the street meant we always had a cool place to go, important during a summer visit. There were several nice restaurants and a food court as well. I did walk to the Old Town from the hotel, but you could take a taxi for under $7. As a female alone while my husband was at business, I felt safe walking in the area. The pool was minimal, at best. While I have no complaints at all about the hotel, if I went back during the summer months, I would probably book a room at the luxury beach hotels (I mean the 6 and 7 star hotels!) instead. During the off-season, you can get those hotels for the same price. However, those hotels are not located convenient to the office areas so that would have to be your consideration.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay...”
Reviews.Author: dirtyeric
Reviews.Content: I was travelling for a business trip.I choose Regent Palace Hotel because of its location.It was my first time.When i arrived,the staff is respectful & they are all smiling,greeting the guests.My room is clean and smells good.The bed is very comfortable and clean.It was really a relaxing stay.Everything was great and for sure i will go back to stay in Regent Palace Hotel.Thanks for the management for taking care of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: India505
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel,beautiful location,wonderful and pleasant staff.mr sachin and mr alex really wonderful and helpful people.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service !!”
Reviews.Author: utkarshmachhar
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very spacious rooms ..

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Naimish
Reviews.Content: It is good hotel, centrally located in Karama (Dubai) approx 30 min from airport. They provide visa services, i.e. if you book room, via email they get us visa within 4-5 working days and they charge on credt card. Its so flexible to get UAE visa sitting in on your own office. They provide airport pickup & drop. There are two bars and two restaurants. Rooms are comfortable, need to buy internet connection. Breakfast - Indian veg. options are available in this hotel. It is near to a big shopping mall and they do have city site seening service every day in the morning. Across the road and behind the hotel, there are several good quality Indian restaurants (walking distance) in addition to hotel food option. Per night it was about 500 Dirhams, which might have gone down in this downturn. For visa service, they take 700 Dirhams per person.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Dubai, never seen a worst 4 star hotel then Regent Palace”
Reviews.Author: RenToronto
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there we spend 35 min for the check in . The girl on the desk was only interested to include the meal on our stay because was great arabic food and bla bla bla. On my experience I never include the meal to don’t get sucked with who knows what is great for them. The first thing I notice was the washroom so dirty and the water pressure was so little that I thought should be a problem with that, so I call the reception. After 1 hour a maintenance guy comes up and tells me this is normal for them. We stayed for 5 nights and they where not changing the sheets every day. If you do not put the towels in the floor they will not change them never. When we came back from a city tour at 6pm the room has not been touched at all , the service room came at 9.30 pm when we where ready to go to sleep. The hotel and restaurant team is so unfriendly that I could not believe . I have never been in Dubai or Middle East before and I don't know who in the hell has gave 4 stars to the Regent Palace Hotel. That hotel has no parking, no balconies, nothing that a 4 star has in western standards, let alone the behavior of the hotel team. I will never recommend this hotel to nobody I know

Reviews.Title: “Choose antoher place PLEASE”
Reviews.Author: MaxAlexander
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Regent Palace for 3 nights. Let me say that today which I'm back, I am suffering from 3 nights without sleep! The sound of music of this hotel bars are loud enough to be heard even in 4th floor until 3:00 AM. It is also good to know that if you have a room facing the street, taxis which stay at the front door of this hotel start to beep and beep and beep from 2:00 in the morning. Simply I can say you will have no convenient night up there. It's even worse if you have to wake up early in the morning to go to work. The staff also seem to act with a 'Don't Care' attitude. Whenever you want something, you need to ask ten times and wait long to have your request done. So please choose another place if you still have time.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there”
Reviews.Author: Retired_BankerLondon
Reviews.Content: We had booked a one nght stay and prepaid. We arrived at 10.00 p m, and were greeted by a surley and rude receptionist. She demaned both our passports, and then a credit card to cover incidentals. Both passports seemed unusual, and although the request for a credit card was not, the follow up request that I gave her my pin number was! Whe I refused, she gave me the machine, and asked me to enter it. I said that I was not happy, and she responded that if I wanted to stay there, I had to input my pin. She assured me that no charge would be passed. After some argument, I entered my pin, and as luck would have it, it was then declined. She then asked for another credid card. At this pojnt, I did refuse, and she then asked for a cash deposit! I refused, and said that they coould send the manager to see me when he was available. Eventuallly, we were shown to our room, which was pretty poorly furnished, and immediately a porter arrived to empty the mini bar!!!! Fortunately, we only stayed one night, which was very noisy, and left at 6.00 a m, vowing never to return. We learned on our return to UK that the hotel tried to take money from my credit card!

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: la_globetrotteuse
Reviews.Content: Being located opposite the Burjuman Center is maybe the only thing going for this hotel. Staff are incredibly rude, grumpy and slow and have no concept whatsoever of customer service. The decor was tacky as well as the evening entertainment. The pool was nice, I went swimming there a few times and the gym was OK, nobody else seemed to be using it though. Breakfast was mainly Indian fare, and was fine if you're used to eating a heavy breakfast in the morning and it varied very little from day to day. I wouldn't book any excursions with them because it's a rip-off, phone calls as well were extremely expensive, there are a lot of fast food restaurants nearby and a supermarket at the end of the road but in general the place is quite grubby and badly maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here. don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: LoveUAE
Reviews.Content: I know is a long review, but PLEASE READ EVERYTHING. Only one word. Terrible. I stayed there in September, and (Lucky me!!!) the Rock Bottom Cafè and the other pubs were closed for the Ramadan. I booked through another website for a room on the Second Floor. When I arrived to my room, I noticed that everything was dirty and not-working: the TV and all the facilities were out of work, no complimentary as Water, tea and coffe that ALL the 4star hotel give u, NO toothpaste-toothbrush. NOTHING FOR a 4 star hotel, and for its rate. But... the best was willing to come. On the second day, I started hearing from the toilet such a terrible smell (i let u imagine which kind of smell) and little noise; passing the hours, the smell began to increase and so the noise. I called the reception maybe 4 or 5 times, and NO ONE arrived. After 1 hour and half, arrived a guy, who had no idea what was happening. He started to do some work on the ceiling of the toilet and.......... I hear a terrible noize, HE BROKE DOWN THE PIPING... and both the toilet and the poor guy were completely covered with .. i let u imagine what. So, i Complained with the reception, and after One hour!!!!!! they gave me a NEW ROOM... do u want to know the best??! They brought to the new room the TOOTHBRUSH i had bought the day before, completely covered by Sh... and pee!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Absolutely AWFUL DREADFUL and TERRIBLE. NEVER EVER STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER EVER STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: thetasteofhoney
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to stay at this hotel for work reasons for a number of weeks and I can tell you the following is shockingly true. Please read the entire review I know its long. 1. Rooms are VERY VERY noisy due to two loud bars , rock bottom ( which is terrible ) and another phillipino bar both with bands and worse LOUD DJ's. This goes onto 3am EVERY night and any room floors 1-3 WILL feel it and hear it. 2. They restored the managment offices for 3 weeks directly under my room and this was jack hammers at 4am , drills , hammering which of course travels nicely in concrete to the base of your bed . Ear plugs in , you can still hear it. They followed this with MORE banging in other parts of the hotel all day and most of the night. 3. Buffet in the sea food resturant WILL give you diarear and / or make you sick as it did for me most days until I stopped eating there. 4. Room cleaners are not bad , but are slow , and hardly ever use a vacume cleaner on the floors. 5. Staff in most cases are grumpy and slow , totally disorganised. and don't care about your sleepless nights . 6. In - Room internet is dial up slow and costs a fortune and when it breaks , it stays broken for 3 days until the useless tech guy decides he is ready to fix it. 7. I was moved to the fourth floor during the noise , which simply meant I heard different banging from different parts of hotel , in addition the room was so damp there was condensation on the mirrors 24 hours a day . When I walked into the service stair well to see why it was so damp , all the floors above 3 had moisture dripping from the walls not good for your health. 8, Management here are without question the worst I have ever seen , from lovely 2 star hotels in bali to 5 stars in Korea this makes even the worst of those look pretty good. 9. GYM , the staff are just plain creepy. NOT one day of going to the gym was I not bothered by a female staff member coming in , turning on the big screen TV LOUD and sitting down and watching an Indian soap opera. On top of this ,imagine using the running machine and some guy comes in and cleans while you are excercising , spraying some cheap and nasty cleaning products directly around you , i didnt have to imagine that it happeneded more than once. My female co-worker also staying here reported the same female staff member attempting to walk into the female changing rooms to see her naked on a number of occasions. My advice . There are much better hotels in Dubai , and if you must visit here choose those hotels NEVER stay at this one or any other RAMEE run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel with 5 star rates”
Reviews.Author: Tango007Uk
Reviews.Content: I found the Corrupt Indian porter demanding money for bringing overnight guest. For that it made my hotel stayed uncormfortable. They charged me $200 for calling a friend in Oman. It is a 2 star hotel with 5 star rates. I would not go to Dubai now, feels like living in a construction site, a small city with no history. Lots of corrupt taxi drivers... pakistanis and indians... Be streetwise out in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Kendrawolf
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at this hotel when booking a trip through lastminute.com - its a great hotel well located for the price. Most hotels tend to be a little pricey, and you pay for your location. We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of April 2008 and enjoyed ourselves The room was very pleasant - reasonably sized and warm, standard facilities of television with satellite. Good double beds - although we were overlooking a busy road we didn’t hear anything. The rooms were clean The breakfast in the morning was very good - a standard hotel buffet type and the staff were very friendly and helpful when we needed them All in all I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for Food Poisioning?”
Reviews.Author: Jeeter
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Dubai with a friend in June of 2006 for a week and stayed at the Regent Palace Hotel. I would not stay at this hotel ever again for a number of reasons. Firstly, the entire hotel had this strong odour of cleaning supplies, that became noxious after 2 - 3 days. Secondly, my friend became violently ill with vomiting and diarrhea after eating at the breakfast buffet - a mistake we did not dare to make again. Thirdly, making tour reservations at the hotel was impossible, we had to take a cab to another hotel in order to make reservations. Fourthly, the plugs in the room didn't work, and I had to use a pen in order to plug the iron in. On the plus side, the room had strong air conditioning and a fridge and safe. Unfortunately, the safe stopped working and all of our valuables were locked inside for the remainder of our trip. All in all, this hotel was definately not worth it's value, and I would recommend not staying here. The other TripAdvisor reviews describe the hotel to the tee, while the staff can be friendly at times, the hotel is very loud and an overall poor choice at best.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected”
Reviews.Author: Isla72
Reviews.Content: Due to ongoing roadworks in the area this hotel is unfortunately not as well placed as it looks on a map. While it is directly opposite a large shopping centre, it takes a 5-10 minute walk to negotiate the building works to actually move from one to the other. The hotel is also conveniently located for catching the airport bus although hotel staff have no information on the route. The room itself was large and comfortable, with a very large television, DVD player and a large bathroom. However: reception staff were slow and disinterested; the concierge was very slow; the mini bar price list was incomplete; the unhappy carp kept in underfloor tanks in the dining hall was in poor taste; breakfast was terrible, and the room suffered from noise and smoke rising from a bar on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs !!!”
Reviews.Author: draigNy
Reviews.Content: I have to stay at this hotel because my company forces me to otherwise I wouldn't go near the place. A room at the front of the hotel has constant noise from the road construction outside (this has been going on for over 12 months) stay in a room on the 3rd floor or lower and you get booming disco and rock music until 3am. After 3am it's honking of car horns as the bars empty. Stay in a front room below the 3rd floor and it's hell !! Staff are totaly unhelpful and indifferent to any request you make, in fact they lie to you constantly. I left my room at 10am every morning returning after 2pm to find that my room still had not been cleaned , despite putting the "clean my room please" sign on the door. The room boy turns up around 6pm offering clean towels instead of cleaning the room. The facities are a joke, a swimming pool on the roof.....it's a kiddies splash pool. Poor quality TV picture with a lack of english language programs. Take a look at the way the electrical equipment is plugged in......overloaded sockets, really safe NOT! No security, anyone can walk in off the street and access any floor of the hotel. The rooms do not have peek-holes in the door or any sort of security chain on the door. Be prepared to be accosted by drunks looking for their mates. I waited for 30 mins to try and get a taxi outside the hotel, the bell boy was supposed to do it for me. He just gave up and walked away. Avoid this hotel if you possibly can, it will ruin your trip!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Regent Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Sheikh Khalifa Bin Zayed Road | PO Box 26816, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
